page.title: 03Brinklow's Woolridge Family
page.content: 7 o'clock - glance at the alarm,my outstretched arm nudges Rob into action,often negotiating the plump intrusion of 4 year old Kit lying like a bolster between us.Rob's action commences with a welcome mug of tea brought back to bed.7.30-all hell breaks loose as we hit the bathroom Liquorice the dog included.Daughter Jolan glides sleepily in a little later having to be cajoled into every movement.Clothes seem to prove a problem to our children hence Jolan's are selected the night before.This would be a waste of time for Kit as it would all be changed anyway as since he's been born we've had a daily row over what he should wear.We hope to have consumed breakfast by 8.30 in time to wave dad off on his motorbike on which he travels to school in Coventry 10 miles away.Jo gets ready
